node.title: Laura was meant to meet her Australian granddaughter this week — but travel rules changed mid-flight
node.alt: A woman with blond hair smiling with a glass of wine and a view of the sea in the background.
node.description: A South African grandmother and other passengers were placed into hotel quarantine when they arrived in Australia, after the government introduced a travel ban against nine African countries while their plane was mid-flight.
node.content:
["This was the week when Laura was finally going to meet her Australian grandchild.", "The South African grandmother hadn't seen her daughter in two and a half years and missed the birth of her granddaughter, who is now almost two, due to COVID-19 border closures.", "But while her flight to Sydney was in mid-air,\u00a0the Australian government announced a sudden travel ban on nine countries, including South Africa.", "When she landed for her two-week visit, Laura \u2014\u00a0who asked to give only her first name \u2014\u00a0was told she would be placed into hotel quarantine for 14 days.", "\"I'm 61 and I cried like a baby. I was devastated,\" she said.", "Before take-off, Laura knew very little about the new Omicron variant, which has triggered similar border closures worldwide.", "Although its emergence has kept her apart from her family and put her in a difficult situation, she was grateful to the scientists and doctors for alerting the world, and to governments\u00a0for taking it seriously.", "\"I thought it's just as well they did that, because I would have hated to go to my family and [for] the little one [to get] something because I may have been in contact [with an infected person] on the plane,\" she said.", "The government has said the border security measures were taken on medical advice and are \"a precaution to protect Australians from the new Omicron variant of concern\".", "As a travel agent, Laura has spent much of the past two years\u00a0booking and rebooking flights for clients who are trapped overseas or who need to travel urgently for family emergencies.", "She's still trying to help clients facing problems with the ban on flights from southern Africa,\u00a0even as she is stuck in a similar predicament.", "\"It's special life moments that you miss,\" she said.", "\"I always thought that the countries were just a flight away, but now I realise the flight doesn't always happen. But I think that's a story all over the world.\"", "
Travel from Zimbabwe halted
", "The travel ban on southern African countries has also impacted Marian\u00a0Chikwanha, a nurse in Ballarat. Her whole family lives in Zimbabwe.", "After working many double shifts to fill the gaps during Victoria's COVID waves, the Australian citizen was planning to fly\u00a0home to spend some long-awaited quality time with her family in February and March.\u00a0", "", "
Marian Chikwanha hopes to see her family in Zimbabwe soon.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "\"I really wanted to be there for my mum's 70th birthday,\" she said.\u00a0", "But her travel plans are now up in the air.", "\"Boom, this one came again,\" she said, referring to the Omicron variant.", "\"I'm really stressed.\"", "Australia's\u00a0ban on travel from southern African nations will last for at least 14 days, but Ms Chikwanha and others are concerned it could stretch out longer.\u00a0", "Fellow Victorian Vin Masuku's family has also been affected by the travel ban.", "His niece had booked a ticket to arrive in Australia on December 3\u00a0to begin her nursing studies after a two-year delay, but her flight was swiftly cancelled.", "\"She was\u00a0ready to come. When she knew people can travel from December 1, she just went straight to the computer to buy a ticket,\" he said.\u00a0", "He described his niece as a bright and dedicated person\u00a0who admired Australia's health system and who wanted to study here to be able to take knowledge back home and improve health care in Zimbabwe.", "
No Omicron in several banned countries
", "South Africa and the World Health Organization (WHO) slammed western countries for the \"unjustified\" border closures.", "Zimbabwe shares a border with South Africa and Botswana, but\u00a0has not yet detected a single case of the Omicron variant.", "The country has been recording an average of around 78 new COVID-19 cases a day, while neighbouring Mozambique's new daily cases have been in the single figures.\u00a0", "Ms Chikwanha said she had mixed emotions about the travel ban on her home country.\u00a0", "\"You want to protect the environment that you are in ... I see what is happening in the community, in the emergency departments ... So I understand what they are doing,\" she said.\u00a0", "But she said she would like to see other measures put in place to support people to travel.", "She added she hoped there would be further investigation\u00a0after\u00a061 passengers tested\u00a0positive\u00a0for the variant in the Netherlands,\u00a0after they should have returned negative COVID tests before leaving South Africa.\u00a0\u00a0", "Africa, as a continent, has a vaccination rate of just over 7 per cent.\u00a0", "\"Vaccine inequality should be addressed ... right now we are having boosters yet other countries do not have enough for first jabs,\" Ms Chikwanha said.", "
'Madness' for stranded travellers\u00a0
", "Kerith Hulme, a South Africa-based travel agent and colleague of Laura's, described the fallout from the travel bans as \"absolute madness\".\u00a0", "", "
The sudden ban left many travellers stranded.(AP: Jerome Delay)
", "The United Kingdom was the first to issue a snap ban \u2014 she received calls from one couple who had just landed in South Africa for a wedding and needed to return immediately, while another woman rang her in tears.\u00a0", "She has more than 50 families on her books affected by the worldwide bans, and was trying to prioritise people who were flying to see dying family members.\u00a0", "Some were able to get a flight but not a spot in a quarantine hotel\u00a0on return to the UK, and therefore could not travel, while many airlines had cancelled inbound flights, stranding people outside their home countries.", "She said the travel ban was seen as \"ridiculous\" by many of the affected countries in the south of Africa, when places\u00a0including Portugal, Belgium, Hong Kong, Canada, Israel and others were not subjected to bans.\u00a0", "\"It's around the world ... and we're the ones who are now just being completely shut out. So I think the overwhelming feeling here is that it's just unjustified. It's not fair,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"Namibia is on most of the travel bans \u2014 they have less than 20 cases a day and they don't have this new variant."]
